title: Relates to prohibiting the possession of a loaded firearm at certain public events
summary: Prohibits the possession of a loaded firearm within one thousand feet of certain public officials; makes such crime a class B felony.

       AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to prohibiting the possession
         of a loaded firearm at certain events involving public officials

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Section 265.04 of the penal law, as amended by chapter 764
    2  of the laws of 2005, is amended to read as follows:
    3  S 265.04 Criminal possession of a weapon in the first degree.
    4    A person is guilty of criminal possession of a  weapon  in  the  first
    5  degree when such person:
    6    (1)  possesses  any  explosive  substance  with intent to use the same
    7  unlawfully against the person or property of another; or
    8    (2) possesses ten or more firearms[.]; OR
    9    (3) INTENTIONALLY POSSESSES A LOADED FIREARM (I) AT AN EVENT HELD IN A
   10  GOVERNMENT BUILDING OR OTHER EVENT SPONSORED BY AN ELECTED  OFFICIAL  AT
   11  WHICH SUCH ELECTED OFFICIAL IS PRESENT, OR (II) AT A DEBATE OR CANDIDATE
   12  FORUM  AT WHICH AN ELECTED OFFICIAL OR A CANDIDATE FOR ELECTED OFFICE IS
   13  PRESENT. THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL NOT APPLY TO  A  PEACE
   14  OFFICER  OR  LAW  ENFORCEMENT  OFFICER  EXERCISING  HIS  OR HER OFFICIAL
   15  DUTIES.
   16    Criminal possession of a weapon in the first degree is a class B felo-
   17  ny.

   19  section  265.20 of the penal law, as added by chapter 843 of the laws of

   21    (b) Police officers as defined in subdivision thirty-four  of  section
   22  1.20 of the criminal procedure law, EXCEPT AS PROVIDED IN SECTION 265.04
   23  OF THIS ARTICLE.
